frame.name: Bringing
frame.definition:
<def-root>This frame concerns the movement of a <fen>Theme</fen> and an <fen>Agent</fen> and/or <fen>Carrier</fen>. The <fen>Agent</fen>, a person or other sentient entity, controls the shared <fen>Path</fen> by moving the <fen>Theme</fen> during the motion. In other words, the <fen>Agent</fen> has overall motion in directing the motion of the <fen>Theme</fen>. The <fen>Carrier</fen> may be a separate entity, or it may be the <fen>Agent</fen>'s body. The <fen>Constant_location</fen> may be a subregion of the <fen>Agent</fen>'s body or (a subregion of) a vehicle that the <fen>Agent</fen> uses.
<ex><fex name="Agent">Karl</fex> <t>carried</t> <fex name="Theme">the books</fex> <fex name="Path">across campus</fex> <fex name="goa">to the library</fex> <fex name="CL">on his head</fex>.</ex> <ex><fex name="Agent">Karl</fex> <t>carried</t> <fex name="Theme">the books</fex> <fex name="Path">across campus</fex> <fex name="goa">to the library</fex> <fex name="CL">in his truck</fex>.</ex> <ex><fex name="Agent">Karl</fex> <t>carried</t> <fex name="Theme">the books</fex> <fex name="Path">across campus</fex> <fex name="goa">to the library</fex> <fex name="Carrier">by truck</fex>.</ex> <ex><fex name="Carrier">The truck</fex> <t>carried</t> <fex name="Theme">the books</fex> <fex name="Path">across campus</fex> <fex name="goa">to the library</fex> <fex name="CL">in specially designed boxes</fex>.</ex> The FEs include <fen>Path</fen>, <fen>Goal</fen>, and <fen>Source</fen>. <fen>Area</fen> is an area that contains the motion when the path is understood as irregular. This frame emphasizes the path of movement as opposed to the FEs Source or Goal as in Filling or Placing. </def-root>

FE.name: Agent
FE.definition: <def-root>The <fen>Agent</fen> is a sentient being who physically controls the movement of the <fen>Theme</fen> via the carrier, accompanying the <fen>Theme</fen>. <ex><fex name="Agent">Karl</fex> <t>carried</t> the books across the campus to the library.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Goal
FE.definition:
<def-root><fen>Goal</fen> identifies the endpoint of the path.
<ex>Karl <t>carried</t> the books <fex name="goa">to the library</fex>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Source
FE.definition:
<def-root><fen>Source</fen> indicates the beginning of the path along which the <fen>Theme</fen> travels.
<ex>Karl <t>hauled</t> the books <fex name="sou">from the library</fex> to the office.</ex> </def-root>

FE.name: Path
FE.definition: <def-root>Path along which carrying occurs. <ex>Karl <t>carried</t> the books <fex name="Path">across the campus</fex>.</ex> </def-root>

FE.name: Theme
FE.definition: <def-root>The objects being carried. <ex>Karl <t>toted</t> <fex name="Theme">the books</fex> to the car.</ex> </def-root>

FE.name: Constant_location
FE.definition:
<def-root>The <fen>Constant_location</fen> expresses the location of the <fen>Theme</fen> relative to the <fen>Carrier</fen>. This relationship holds for the entire length of the carrying event.
<ex>Karl <t>took</t> the books to the library <fex name="CL">in his car</fex>.</ex> <ex>Karl <t>carried</t> the books to the library <fex name="CL">in his arms</fex>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Area
FE.definition: <def-root><fen>Area</fen> is used for descriprion of a general area in which the carrying action takes place when the motion is understood to be irregular or not to consist of a single, linear path.</def-root>

FE.name: Depictive
FE.definition: <def-root><fen>Depictive</fen> identifies a phrase describing the <fen>Carrier</fen>, <fen>Agent</fen> or <fen>Theme</fen>.</def-root>

FE.name: Distance
FE.definition: <def-root>This FE identifies the <fen>Distance</fen> the <fen>Theme</fen> is carried.</def-root>

FE.name: Manner
FE.definition: <def-root>This FE identifies the <fen>Manner</fen> in which the <fen>Carrier</fen> or <fen>Agent</fen> carries the <fen>Theme</fen> .</def-root>

FE.name: Speed
FE.definition: <def-root>The <fen>Speed</fen> is the rate at which the carrying or transporting occurs.</def-root>

FE.name: Purpose
FE.definition: <def-root>The <fen>Purpose</fen> for which the <fen>Carrier</fen> or <fen>Agent</fen> carries the <fen>Theme</fen> . <ex>We had to <t>carry</t> the heavy weights all the way to the top of the hill<fex name="Pps">to show our strength</fex>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Carrier
FE.definition: <def-root>The <fen>Carrier</fen> provides support for the <fen>Theme</fen>. Movement of the <fen>Carrier</fen> results in movement of the <fen>Theme</fen>. <ex><fex name="Car">The boat</fex> <t>ferried</t> the troops across the river.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Means
FE.definition: <def-root>The actions the <fen>Agent</fen> takes to move the <fen>Theme</fen>. <ex>The books were <t>taken</t> to the library <fex name="Mns">by helicopter deliveries</fex>.</ex> <ex>I <t>haul</t> books <fex name="Mns">by putting them on top of my head</fex>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Place
FE.definition: <def-root>The <fen>Place</fen> is the general area that serves as a setting for the specific motion of the <fen>Agent</fen> and <fen>Theme</fen> (with <fen>Source</fen>, <fen>Path</fen>, or <fen>Goal</fen>). <ex><fex name="Place">Even in such a small port</fex>, these boats would <t>transport</t> many tons of trade-goods in to shore annually.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Time
FE.definition: <def-root>The time in which the carrying event takes place.</def-root>

FE.name: Explanation
FE.definition: <def-root><fen>Explanation</fen> denotes a proposition from which the main clause (headed by the target) logically follows. This often means that the <fen>Explanation</fen> causes the target's proposition, but not in all cases. </def-root>

FE.name: Beneficiary
FE.definition: <def-root>This FE describes the particpant for whom the bringing is beneficial. </def-root>

FE.name: Particular_iteration
FE.definition: <def-root>Expressions marked with this extra-thematic FE modify a non-iterative use of the target, and indicate that it is conceived as embedded within an iterated series of similar events or states.</def-root>

FE.name: Frequency
FE.definition: <def-root>This frame element is used to indicate the location of a participant in cases where the multiple participants of an event are not co-located in the typical fashion. </def-root>

FE.name: Degree
FE.definition: <def-root>This frame element selects some gradable attribute and modifies the expected value for it.</def-root>

FE.name: Co-participant
FE.definition: <def-root>Co_participant is an entity that participates in a coordinated way in the same event as the primary protagonist, regardless of whether the protagonist, and hence the <fex name="Co-participant">Co-participant</fex>, is more agent- or more undergoer-like.</def-root>

FE.name: Duration
FE.definition: <def-root>Duration denotes the length of time from the beginning of a continuous situation (the one denoted by the target) to its end. In many cases, the continuous situation is a dynamic action which is ongoing, while in others it is simply an undifferentiated state.</def-root>

FE.name: Period_of_iterations
FE.definition: <def-root>This FE is minimally distinct from Duration and Duration_of final_state in that the clause described is conveyed to be iterative.</def-root>

lexUnit.name: optellen.v
lexUnit.definition: bij elkaar tellen, uitrekenen hoeveel iets samen is
